meanings.definition: A surprise attack in which the attackers wear camisados.
meanings.sent1: During the battle, the soldiers launched camisados to catch the enemy off guard.
meanings.sent2: The army planned a camisados to ambush the opposing forces.
meanings.sent3: The camisados at the break of dawn left the enemy bewildered.
meanings.sent4: The camisados was like a silent ghost haunting the battlefield.
meanings.sent5: The memory of the camisados lingered in the minds of the defeated troops.

meanings.definition: A light coat or jacket worn by soldiers.
meanings.sent1: The soldiers put on their camisados to shield themselves from the cold wind.
meanings.sent2: The camisados provided protection without weighing the soldiers down.
meanings.sent3: The comical sight of a tiny dog wearing a camisados amused the troops.
meanings.sent4: The camisados transformed the soldiers into a sea of blue on the battlefield.
meanings.sent5: The bright red camisados stood out among the army, a symbol of unity.
